lines.text: Right-hand rule indicates direction of field
Point thumb in direction of conventional current
Curled fingers show direction of magnetic field

secText:
Lesson:
1. Experiment with magnetic fields created by electric currents.
2. Describe the magnetic fields created by electric currents. Determine the direction of current in a magnetic field using the right-hand rule.
3. Determine the force between two current-carrying wires.
4. Apply the concept of magnetic fields induced by electric currents to electric motors.
5. Describe commutators.
Quick Review: Currents and Magnetic Fields
